sopamm_metamodelv2:Catalogue.Name: Requirement Patterns For Certification Of Electronic Health Record Systems by Brazilian Society of Health Informatics

softwarepatternbag.Name: SPB_AuthenticationLoginPassword
softwarepatternbag.Problem: Only authenticated users can access the system
softwarepatternbag.Context: Users should be able to perform authentication with login and password on the system

softwarepattern.Name: FRP_AuthenticationLoginPassword
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: User must be identified and authenticated with login and password to access system data or functionality
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

feature.Label: Feature_Authentication through login and password
feature.I_can: authenticate me with login and password

scenario.Label: Scenario_SuccessfulLogin
scenario.Given: I am accessing the login function
scenario.When: I type <login> and <password> correct pair
scenario.Then: I must be authenticated with the <role> assigned to me AND see the time message of your user's last successful authentication; date and time of unsuccessful authentication attempts after the last successful authentication.

scenario.Label: Scenario_Login failed - Invalid username
scenario.Given: I am accessing the login function
scenario.When: I <login> and <password> and the login is invalid
scenario.Then: An error message should be displayed

scenario.Label: Scenario_Login failed - Invalid password
scenario.Given: I am accessing the login function
scenario.When: I type <login> and <password> and the password is invalid
scenario.Then: An error message should be displayed

softwarepattern.Name: ATP_AuthenticationLoginPassword
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Test login and password authentication function
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

softwarepattern.Name: NFRP_RestrictionsOfLoginPasswordAuthentication
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Set Requirements Restrictions of User Authentication with Login and Password
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

systemproperty.Name: Server-side authentication service
systemproperty.Description: Credentials for authentication to the system must be validated after submission to the server-side system authentication service, preventing validation from happening on the client-side.

systemproperty.Name: Authentication error message
systemproperty.Description: In case of invalid authentication on attempted access, the error message issued by the system to the user should not state the reason for the error.

systemproperty.Name: Prevent access by unauthorized persons
systemproperty.Description: Prevent access or viewing of the records by unauthorized persons

systemproperty.Name: Access to system data through predefined channels only
systemproperty.Description: Ensure that access to the system data is only possible through predefined interaction channels (eg web, local console, application interface), with mandatory access control mechanisms.

systemproperty.Name: Store password encoded by hash algorithm
systemproperty.Description: The password must be stored in a database, encoded by a minimum (160-bit) open (public) hash algorithm.

systemproperty.Name: Access to password encoding
systemproperty.Description: Password encodings are protected against unauthorized access. Only the database user used by the system must access these.

systemproperty.Name: Password generating
systemproperty.Description: When generating or changing a password that is not set by the user himself, such process should prevent that third parties viewing the password.

systemproperty.Name: Login and passwrod memorization
systemproperty.Description: The user interface used for entering login and password should prevent the memorization and viewing of previous data.

systemproperty.Name: Password with character mask
systemproperty.Description: Any direct password entry must be done through a character mask that prevents others from viewing it.

systemproperty.Name: Using SALT (R)
systemproperty.Description: Implement SALT techniques for password encoding

softwarepatternbag.Name: SPB_AuthenticationDigitalCertificate
softwarepatternbag.Problem: Only authenticated users can access the system
softwarepatternbag.Context: Users should be able to perform authentication with digital certificate

softwarepattern.Name: FRP_AuthenticationDigitalCertificate
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: User must be identified and authenticated with digital certificate to access system data or functionality
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

scenario.Label: Scenario_AuthenticationDigitalCertificateSuccessfully
scenario.Given: I am accessing the login function
scenario.When: I use a valid <digital certificate>
scenario.Then: I must be authenticated with the <role> assigned to me AND see the time message of your user's last successful authentication; date and time of unsuccessful authentication attempts after the last successful authentication.

scenario.Label: Scenario_InvalidDigitalCertificate
scenario.Given: I am accessing the login function
scenario.When: I use an invalid <digital certificate>
scenario.Then: An error message should be displayed

scenario.Label: Scenario_ExpiredDigitalCertificate
scenario.Given: I am accessing the login function
scenario.When: I use an expired <digital certificate>
scenario.Then: An error message should be displayed

softwarepattern.Name: ATP_AuthenticationDigitalCertificate
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Test authentication with digital certificate
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

softwarepattern.Name: NFRP_RestrictionsOfAuthentication DigitalCertificate
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Set Requirements Restrictions of User Authentication with Digital Certificate
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

systemproperty.Name: Authentication error message
systemproperty.Description: In case of invalid authentication on attempted access, the error message issued by the system to the user should not state the reason for the error.

systemproperty.Name: Prevent access by unauthorized persons
systemproperty.Description: Prevent access or viewing of the records by unauthorized persons

systemproperty.Name: Access to system data through predefined channels only
systemproperty.Description: Ensure that access to the system data is only possible through predefined interaction channels (eg web, local console, application interface), with mandatory access control mechanisms.

systemproperty.Name: Prevent unauthorized alteration of the trusted root digital certificate
systemproperty.Description: The S-RES must support security controls that ensure integrity and prevent unauthorized alteration of the trusted root digital certificate relationship.

softwarepatternbag.Name: SPB_AuthenticationBiometric
softwarepatternbag.Problem: Only authenticated users can access the system
softwarepatternbag.Context: Users should be able to perform biometric authentication

softwarepattern.Name: FRP_AuthenticationBiometric
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: User must be identified and authenticated with biometric functions to access system data or functionality
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

scenario.Label: Scenario_UserAuthenticationBiometricSuccessfully
scenario.Given: I am accessing the login function
scenario.When: I use a valid biometrics
scenario.Then: I must be authenticated with the <role> assigned to me AND see the time message of your user's last successful authentication; date and time of unsuccessful authentication attempts after the last successful authentication.

scenario.Label: Scenario_InvalidBiometrics
scenario.Given: I am accessing the login function
scenario.When: I use an invalid biometrics
scenario.Then: An error message should be displayed

softwarepattern.Name: ATP_AuthenticationBiometric
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Test authentication with biometric autenticathion
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

softwarepattern.Name: NFRP_RestrictonsOfBiometricsAutenticathion
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Set Requirements Restrictions of User Authentication with Biometrics
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

systemproperty.Name: Storage location of biometric data
systemproperty.Description: The storage location of biometric data must be protected against unauthorized access.

softwarepatternbag.Name: SPB_ControlWrongLogins
softwarepatternbag.Problem: User cannot make invalid authentication attempts more than sometimes allowed
softwarepatternbag.Context: The system must control the amount of invalid login attempts and block the user. The allowed quantity is set.

softwarepattern.Name: FRP_ControlWrongLogins
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Control the amount of invalid login attempts and block the user.
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

feature.Label: Feature_ControlWrongLogins
feature.So_that: control the amount of login attempts

scenario.Label: Scenario_ControlBlockInvalidLogin
scenario.Given: I am authenticating in the system
scenario.When: I use a <login> invalid
scenario.Then: blocks my system <block_login>

scenario.Label: Scenario_ControlBlockInvalidPassword
scenario.Given: I am authenticating in the system
scenario.When: I use a valid <login> AND invalid <password>
scenario.Then: blocks my system <block_login>

scenario.Label: Scenario_ControlBlockInvalidDigitalCertificate
scenario.Given: I am authenticating in the system
scenario.When: I use a invalid <digital_certificate>
scenario.Then: blocks my system <block_login>

scenario.Label: Scenario_ControlBlockInvalidBiometric
scenario.Given: I am authenticating in the system
scenario.When: I use a invalid <biometric>
scenario.Then: blocks my system <block_login>

softwarepattern.Name: ATP_ATPControlWrongLogins
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Test control of how many invalid login and user lockout attempts
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

softwarepattern.Name: SetNumberInvalidAuthentication
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Set maximum allowed number of invalid authentication attempts before blocking user
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

feature.Label: Feature_SetNumberAuthentication
feature.I_can: Set allowed number of invalid authentication attempts
feature.So_that: to block user attempting invalid authentication more than allowed number

scenario.Label: Scenario_SetInvalidNumber
scenario.Given: I am accessing the system as an administrator
scenario.When: I try to change the invalid login attempts parameter to <n>
scenario.Then: the system should issue the message "Number of retries must be between 1 and 10"

scenario.Label: Scenario_SetValidNumber
scenario.Given: I am accessing the system as an administrator
scenario.When: I try to change the valid login attempts parameter to <n>
scenario.Then: the system must save the new parameter and issue the changed message successfully.

softwarepattern.Name: TestMaximumAllowedNumberAuthentication
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Test set maximum allowed number of invalid authentication attempts before blocking user
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

softwarepattern.Name: FRP_Unlock a user account
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Unlock a locked user account
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

feature.Label: Feature_UnlockUser
feature.I_can: Unlock a locked user account on S-RES
feature.So_that: the user can access the system

scenario.Label: Scenario_UnlockUser
scenario.Given: I am accessing the system as an administrator
scenario.When: I unlock a user
scenario.Then: The user can authenticate in the system

softwarepattern.Name: ATP_UnlockUserAccount
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Test unlock a user account
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

softwarepatternbag.Name: SPB_PasswordReseting
softwarepatternbag.Problem: Only users with valid passwrod can access the system
softwarepatternbag.Context: User must be able to reset their system access password

softwarepattern.Name: FRP_PasswordReseting
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: User must be able to change the password to a new valid password and different from the previous one
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

scenario.Label: PasswordResetingSuccessfull
scenario.Given: I am accessing the login change function
scenario.When: I enter <login>, <current_password>, <new_password> and <confirm_new_password> equal and containing more than 8 characters, matching at least 1 letter and 1 number
scenario.Then: My password is changed

businessrules.Name: UseAlgoritmHash
businessrules.Description: Modify password must use hash algorithm

scenario.Label: DontChangePasswordUnder8Characters
scenario.Given: I am accessing the login change function
scenario.When: I enter <login>, <current_password>, <new_password> AND <confirm_new_password> and new_password contain less than 8 characters
scenario.Then: The system should show an error message and it shouldn't be possible to change my password

scenario.Label: DontChangePasswordOnlyWithLetters
scenario.Given: I am accessing the login change function
scenario.When: I enter <login>, <current_password>, <new_password> AND <confirm_new_password> and new_password contain only letters
scenario.Then: The system should show an error message and it shouldn't be possible to change my password

scenario.Label: DontChangePasswordOnlyWithNumbers
scenario.Given: I am accessing the login change function
scenario.When: I enter <login>, <current_password>, <new_password> AND <confirm_new_password> and new_password contain only numbers
scenario.Then: The system should show an error message and it shouldn't be possible to change my password

scenario.Label: DontChangePasswordDifferentConfirmation
scenario.Given: I am accessing the login change function
scenario.When: I enter <login>, <current_password>, <new_password> AND <confirm_new_password>, but new_password and confirm_new_password are different from each other
scenario.Then: The system should show an error message and it shouldn't be possible to change my password

scenario.Label: DontChangePasswordToTheSameValue
scenario.Given: I am accessing the login change function
scenario.When: I enter <login>, <current_password>, <new_password> AND <confirm_new_password>, but new_password has the same value that current_password
scenario.Then: The system should show an error message and it shouldn't be possible to change my password

softwarepattern.Name: ATP_PasswordReseting
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Test password reseting function
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

uielements.Elements: login, current_password, new_password, confirm_new_password, btnok, errorMessage
login, current_password, new_password, confirm_new_password, btnok, errorMessage
login, current_password, new_password, confirm_new_password, btnok, errorMessage
login, current_password, new_password, confirm_new_password, btnok, errorMessage
login, current_password, new_password, confirm_new_password, btnok, errorMessage

softwarepattern.Name: FRP_PasswordChangePeriodicity
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Manager / Administrator can set period for change password
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

feature.Label: Feature_PasswordChangePeriodicity
feature.So_that: the system can automatically control the password change time

scenario.Label: Scenario_PeriodSuccessfullChanged
scenario.Given: I am accessing the function to set password change frequency
scenario.When: I try to change the maximum password change period to <n> months
scenario.Then: the system must change the maximum password period

businessrules.Name: MaximumChangeTime
businessrules.Description: The maximum configurable password change time should not exceed 6 months.

scenario.Label: Scenario_PeriodGreaterThan6Months
scenario.Given: I am accessing the function to set password change frequency
scenario.When: I try to change the maximum password change period to <n>
scenario.Then: the system should not change the period and should display an error message "Period greater than 6 months"

scenario.Label: Scenario_PeriodLessThan1Month
scenario.Given: I am accessing the function to set password change frequency
scenario.When: I try to change the maximum password change period to <n>
scenario.Then: the system should not change the period and should display an error message "Period may not be less than 1 month"

softwarepattern.Name: ATP_PasswordChangePeriodicity
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Test password change periodicity
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

steps.Steps: I try to change the maximum password change period to <n> months (Integer months)
I try to change the maximum password change period to <n> (Integer months)
I try to change the maximum password change period to <n> (Integer months)

softwarepattern.Name: FRP_ForcedPasswordChange
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Manager / administrator may request password change
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

feature.Label: Feature_ForcedPasswordChange
feature.So_that: user is forced to change password at next login

scenario.Label: Scenario_ForcePasswordChangeAtNextLogin
scenario.Given: I am accessing the function to set force password change at next login
scenario.When: I enable the flag for change password <flag> for user <login>
scenario.Then: the system must force this user to change the password on next access

softwarepattern.Name: FRP_ServerRequestPasswordChange
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Server should automatically request password change
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

feature.Label: Feature_ServerRequestPasswordChange
feature.So_that: the user has access to the system

scenario.Label: Scenario_ServerRequestPasswordChange
scenario.Given: I am trying access the system
scenario.When: The system enabled the flag <flag> for change password for my user <login> AND I enter my <login>
scenario.Then: The server requires me to change my password

softwarepattern.Name: Restrictions of change password requirements
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Set password change requirements restrictions
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

systemproperty.Name: ErrorMessage
systemproperty.Description: In case of invalid password, the error message issued by the system to the user should not state the reason for the error.

softwarepattern.Name: FRP_CRUD_User
softwarepattern.Author: Taciana Novo Kudo
softwarepattern.Goal: Manager / Administrator can manage (create, retrieve, update, delete) data from a system user
softwarepattern.Source: Brazilian Society of Health Informatics - Certification Manual for Electronic Health Record Systems - Version 4.2

feature.Label: Feature_CreateUser
feature.So_that: include new user on the system

scenario.Label: Scenario_CreateUserSuccessfully
scenario.Given: I want to create a new user
scenario.When: When I enter <name>, <function>, <gender>, <date of birth>, <father's name>, <mother's name> and <role>
scenario.Then: The system must create a new user with these data

example.Examples: CPF | name | gender | date of birth | father's name | mother's name | Role
735.101.320-92 | Carlos Chegas | Male | 01.01.2000 | Jose Chegas | Carla Chegas | Doctor and system user
342.052.020-40 | Josér Mouro Brasil | Male | 01.01.2000 | Jose Brasil | Josefa Brasil | | Ophthalmologist Doctor and system user
238.311.950-48 | Sheila Sherloqui | Female | 01.01.2000 | Jose Sherloqui | Maria Sherloqui | Gastroenterologist Doctor and system user
597.835.250-00 | Manoel Abreu | Male | 01.01.2000 | Jose Abreu | Maria Abreu | Radiologist Doctor and system user
171.205.000-15 | Ana Meri | female | 01.01.2000 | Jose Meri | Maria Meri | Nurse and system user
537.373.770-49 | Ana Tequi | Female | 01.01.2000 | Jose Tequi | Maria Tequi | Nursing technique and sysstem user
664.810.070-20 | Erlen Maier | Male | 01.01.2000 | Jose Maier | Maria Maier | Pharmaceutical Biochemical and system user
079.001.480-78 | José Silva Filho | male | 10.18.2004 | José Silva | Bianca Silva | Ophthalmology patient in an elective consultation without SRES access
642.791.520-71 | José Kiake | Male | 01.01.2000 | Jose Kiake | Luiza Kiake | SRES Systems Security Manager |
708.961.430-15 | José Pazter | Male | 01.01.2000 | José Pazter | Erna Pazter | Clinical pathologist Doctor and system user
414.702.770-93 | José Audi Torres | Male | 01.01.2000 | Jose Audi | Mama Audi | external auditor
407.901.880-07 | Maria Bienvenu | Female | 01.01.2000 | Jose Bienvenu | Maria Bienvenu | Receptionist and system user
556.078.430-33 | Mario Perador | Male | 01.01.2000 | Jose Perador | Maria Perador | System Programmer
794.228.140-06 | José Kodaqui | Male | 01.01.2000 | José Kodaqui | Maria Kodaqui | Radiology Technician and system user
836.111.680-09 | José Padilha | Male | 01.01.2000 | José Padilha | Maria Padilha | Administration of ambulatory
466.963.820-38 | Vera Dimin | Female | 01.01.2000 | Jose Dimin | Maria Dimin | System Administrator

scenario.Label: Scenario_CreateUserExistingID
scenario.Given: I want to create a new user
scenario.When: When I enter an existing <CPF>
scenario.Then: The system should display an "This user is already registered" message

scenario.Label: Scenario_TryCreateUserInvalidID
scenario.Given: I want to create a new user
scenario.When: When I enter a invalid <CPF>
scenario.Then: The system should display an "This is an invalid ID" message

scenario.Label: Scenario_RetrieveUserSuccessfullyByName
scenario.Given: I am looking for an user
scenario.When: search for a user <name> that exist
scenario.Then: Show all user data

scenario.Label: Scenario_RetrieveUserUnsuccessfullByName
scenario.Given: I am looking for an user
scenario.When: search for a user <name> that does not exist
scenario.Then: The system should display an "User not found" message

scenario.Label: Scenario_RetrieveUserSuccessfullyByCPF
scenario.Given: I am looking for an user
scenario.When: search for a user <cpf> that exist
scenario.Then: Show all user data

scenario.Label: Scenario_RetrieveUserUnsuccessfullByCPF
scenario.Given: I am looking for an user
scenario.When: search for a user <cpf> that does not exist
scenario.Then: The system should display an "User not found" message

scenario.Label: Scenario_UpdateUserSuccessfully
scenario.Given: I want update a user data
scenario.When: When I enter new <name>, <function>, <gender>, <date of birth>, <father's name>, <mother's name> or <role>
scenario.Then: The system must update these user data

example.Examples: 735.101.320-92 | Carlos Chegas | Male | 01.01.2000 | Jose Chegas | Carla Chegas | Doctor and system user

scenario.Label: Scenario_UpdateUserUnsuccessful
scenario.Given: I want update a user data
scenario.When: When I leave one of the fields unfilled <name>, <function>, <gender>, <date of birth>, <father's name>, <mother's name> or <role> AND
scenario.Then: The system should display an "Invalid Data" message

example.Examples: 735.101.320-92 | | Male | 01.01.2000 | Jose Chegas | Carla Chegas | Doctor and system user
735.101.320-92 | Carlos Chegas | | 01.01.2000 | Jose Chegas | Carla Chegas | Doctor and system user
735.101.320-92 | Carlos Chegas | Male | | Jose Chegas | Carla Chegas | Doctor and system user
735.101.320-92 | Carlos Chegas | Male | 01.01.2000 | | Carla Chegas | Doctor and system user
735.101.320-92 | Carlos Chegas | Male | 01.01.2000 | Jose Chegas | | Doctor and system user
735.101.320-92 | Carlos Chegas | Male | 01.01.2000 | Jose Chegas | Carla Chegas |

feature.Label: Feature_DeleteUser
feature.So_that: for a user to be deleted from the system

scenario.Label: Scenario_DeleteUserSuccessfully
scenario.Given: I am trying to delete a user
scenario.When: I inform the user's <CPF> AND this user has not performed any operation on the system
scenario.Then: This user must be deleted

scenario.Label: Scenario_DeleteUserUnsuccessfull
scenario.Given: I am trying to delete a user
scenario.When: I inform the user's <CPF> AND this user has performed any operation on the system
scenario.Then: The system should display an "It is not possible to delete this user because he has already done system operations" message
